## Introduction

-   Figuring out the best prompt to create a perfect image is a particular challenge.
-   Research into methods to do so is not quite as developed as text prompting.
-   This may be due to inherent challenges in creating objects which are fundamentally subjective and often lack good accuracy metrics.

## Style Modifiers

-   Style modifiers are simply descriptors which consistently produce certain styles (e.g. 'tinted red', 'made of glass', 'rendered in Unity')1. They can be combined together to produce even more specific styles. They can "include information about art periods, schools, and styles, but also art materials and media, techniques, and artists"1.

#### Example

Here are a few pyramids generated by DALLE, with the prompt pyramid
![i](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/pyramids-dbd24886538cd0b91495876e2ad5f70f.webp)

Here are a few pyramids generated by DALLE, with the prompt A pyramid made of glass, rendered in Unity and tinted red, which uses 3 style modifiers.
![o](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/red_pyramids-b699471b16904b68d72e7b2ca9343ec5.webp)

**Here is a list of some useful style modifiers:**

```
photorealistic, by greg rutkowski, by christopher nolan, painting, digital painting, concept art, octane render, wide lens, 3D render, cinematic lighting, trending on ArtStation, trending on CGSociety, hyper realist, photo, natural light, film grain
```

## Quality Boosters

Quality boosters1 are terms added to a prompt to improve certain non-style-specific qualities of the generated image. For example "amazing", "beautiful", and "good quality" are all quality boosters that can be used to improve the quality of the generated image.

#### Example

Here are a few pyramids generated by DALLE, with the prompt pyramid
![i](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/pyramids-dbd24886538cd0b91495876e2ad5f70f.webp)

Now take at pyramids generated with this prompt:

```
A beautiful, majestic, incredible pyramid, 4K
```

![ii](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/special_pyramids-50f3bca3db5e95b3ae5ebb75ab00da47.webp)

**Here is a list of a number of quality boosters:**

```
High resolution, 2K, 4K, 8K, clear, good lighting, detailed, extremely detailed, sharp focus, intricate, beautiful, realistic+++, complementary colors, high quality, hyper detailed, masterpiece, best quality, artstation, stunning.
```

## Repetition

Repeating the same word within a prompt, or similar phrases can cause the model to emphasize that word in the generated image1.
Ex: A beautiful painting of a mountain next to a waterfall..
![u](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/bad_water-3488cfe44ea4d3ce585935b4b955ad07.webp)

A very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very very beautiful painting of a mountain next to a waterfall.
![p](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/good_water-f78c311fb0cdb9aecdcd6bc8e7f47f28.webp)

**The emphasis on the word very seems to improve generation quality! Repetition can also be used to emphasize subject terms.**

For example, if you want to generate an image of a planet with aliens, using the prompt A planet with aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens will make it more likely that aliens are in the resultant image.
It A planet with aliens,
![u](data:image/webp;base64,)

FOr this prompt, A planet with aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens aliens
![i](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/planet_aliens-d07007a60f11ef69df4b10814d477d4b.webp)

**This method is not perfect, and using weights (next article) is often a better option.**

## Weighted Terms

Some models (Stable Diffusion, Midjourney, etc.) allow you to weight terms in a prompt. This can be used to emphasize certain words or phrases in the generated image. It can also be used to de-emphasize certain words or phrases in the generated image. Let's consider a simple example:

#### Example

Here are a few mountains generated by Stable Diffusion, with the prompt mountain
![y](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/mountains-879e27bb217169838c5ce1f49cebc1a0.webp)

Now, However, if we want mountains without trees, we can use the prompt mountain | tree:-10. Since we weighted tree very negatively, they do not appear in the generated image.
![m](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/mountains_no_trees-36a39df6b44f0e6e24f1238a29c2e034.webp)

Weighted terms can be combined into more complicated prompts, like **A planet in space:10 | bursting with color red, blue, and purple:4 | aliens:-10 | 4K, high quality**
![d](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/planets-ba6764aa7046af4d18b4e24ce3caeeed.webp)

## Fix Deformed Generations

Deformed generations, particularly on human body parts (e.g. hands, feet), are a common issue with many models. This can be dealt with to some extent with good negative prompts1.

Ex:

```studio medium portrait of Brad Pitt waving his hands, detailed, film, studio lighting, 90mm lens, by Martin Schoeller:6

```

![uu](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/bad_pitt-0a78738e39d116b1ec1c7e74b498b032.webp)

Using a robust negative prompt, we can generate much more convincing hands.

```
studio medium portrait of Brad Pitt waving his hands, detailed, film, studio lighting, 90mm lens, by Martin Schoeller:6 | disfigured, deformed hands, blurry, grainy, broken, cross-eyed, undead, photoshopped, overexposed, underexposed, lowres, bad anatomy, bad hands, extra digits, fewer digits, bad digit, bad ears, bad eyes, bad face, cropped: -5
```

![g](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/good_pitt-ab97efa681b66b1af571472dcca1bf06.webp)

## Shot type

Shot types refer to the various camera angles and compositions used in filmmaking to capture different perspectives and visual effects within a scene. These shot types play a crucial role in conveying the story, setting the mood, and influencing the audience's perception and emotions.

There are several kinds of shot types, which each serve their own unique purpose. Some common examples include long shot, medium shot, bird-eye shot, and low-angle shot.

#### Example

Prompt: astronaut standing in the street, Shot type, HD, 4K, --no blur, --no distortion.

Replace Shot type with desired shot type.
![tt](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/long_shot-a5960b6ecf8a4390f0db460a3a372cbc.webp)
![u](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/medium_shot-427ca727f08ef9a0d98206ea83065124.webp)

**Here is a list of commonly used shot types:**

```
Wide Shot/Establishing Shot, Long Shot, Full Shot, Medium Shot, Cowboy Shot, Medium Close-Up, Close-Up, Extreme Close-Up, Two-Shot, Over-the-Shoulder Shot, Point-of-View Shot (POV), Reaction Shot, Insert Shot, Cutaway Shot, Low Angle Shot, High Angle Shot, Dutch Angle/Tilted Shot, Aerial Shot, Tracking Shot, Dolly Shot, Steadicam Shot, Crane Shot, Handheld Shot, Whip Pan Shot, Zoom Shot, Rack Focus Shot, Split Screen Shot, Freeze Frame Shot, Slow Motion Shot, Fast Motion Shot, Montage Shot, Cross-Cutting Shot, Bird's Eye View Shot, Worm's Eye View Shot, Reverse Shot, Reaction Shot, Panning Shot, Tilt Shot, Follow Shot, Static Shot, Establishing Drone Shot, Underwater Shot, POV Drone Shot, Crash Zoom Shot, Snorricam Shot, Tracking POV Shot, Vertigo Shot (Dolly Zoom), Flashback Shot, Flashforward Shot, Static Long Take Shot.
```

## Midjourney

Midjourney is an AI image generator that operates through a Discord bot interface as well as a web app (an API version of Midjourney is planned). The process for generating images with Midjourney follows the same fundamental principles as other AI image generators, including the use of prompts to guide the generation process.

One of the unique features of Midjourney compared to other AI image generators is its ability to create visually striking and artistically composed images. This is attributed to the model's specialized training, which enables it to produce high-quality images with specific artistic parameters (more about this in "Advanced Prompts" > "Parameters").

#### Basic Usage

The basic prompt anatomy with Midjourney is /imagine prompt: [IMAGE PROMPT] [--OPTIONAL PARAMETERS].

For example: /imagine prompt: astronaut on a horse

![im](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut-c1178f99868c1e9ec35cae193c627d5e.webp)

Example with parameters: /imagine prompt: astronaut on a horse --ar 3:2 --c 70 --q 2 --seed 1000
![ee](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params-8a1d5ec9ea73d4023e5cfaefded82db4.webp)

In this basic example the following parameters have been used:

**--ar 3:2** sets the aspect ratio of the image to 3:2

**--c 70** adds a chaos value of 70 to allow Midjourney to interpret the prompt more freely(chaos value range: 0 - 100)

**--seed 100** sets an arbitrary seed value which can be used to re-render or re-work an image later

### Multi Prompts

Midjourney interprets your prompt holistically by default. Using a double colon :: tells Midjourney to interpret each part of a prompt separately.

#### Example:

```
/imagine prompt: astronaut and horse
```

![yt](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_multi1-8f8f511f1b7859d42e0dc247036a1759.webp)

```
/imagine prompt: astronaut:: and horse
```

![uu](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_multi2-49ef73cfafd01a45d522b6645dd4f1ba.webp)

### Parameters (v4)

The following parameters are supported by Midjourney's latest model (v4).

#### Aspect Ratio:

--ar [ratio] changes the default ratio (1:1) to a new ratio (currently the max. supported ratio is 2:1)

Example: astronaut on a horse --ar 16:9 and astronaut on a horse --ar 1:2
![d](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_a169-43817100725f269212311b1b00a95a61.webp)
![yy](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_a12-0fcf66f6dc549715488275cf91e5e31f.webp)

#### Chaos:

--c [value] sets a chaos value that determines how much Midjourney varies the prompt; the higher the chaos value the more unusual and unexpected the results and compositions (range: 0 - 100)

Example: astronaut on a horse --c20 and astronaut on a horse --c 80
![u](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_c20-0906472c339fea034d34932bc7d880b8.webp)
![p](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_c80-b550697cb031f8fa436adf5a23f572e5.webp)

#### Quality:

--q [value] defines how much time will be spend generating the image, thus increasing the quality. The default setting is "1". Higher values use more of your subscription's GPU minutes (accepts values ".25", ".5" , "1" and "2")

Example: astronaut on a horse --q .5 and astronaut on a horse --q 2
![y](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_q05-ab11d4f0b4842a73fc7160650d62b8d7.webp)
![image](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_q2-d95eb986d35f5db4966ad828db61ffd0.webp)

#### Seed:

--seed [value] sets a seed number which defines the starting point (noise field) for the image generation. The seeds for each image are generated randomly when not specified with the seed parameter. Using the same seed number and prompt will produce similar images.

Example: astronaut on a horse --seed 123
![p](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_seed123-d95eb986d35f5db4966ad828db61ffd0.webp)
![i](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_seed123-d95eb986d35f5db4966ad828db61ffd0.webp)

#### Stylize:

--stylize [value] or --s [value] influences how strongly Midjourney applies its artistic algorithm. Low values produce images that closely match the prompt, high values create very artistic images that are less connected to the prompt. The default is 100, value range is 0 - 1000. (Note: you can use the /settingscommand to change the default stylize value from

-   "🖌️ Style Med" (=--s 100)
-   "🖌️ Style Low" (=--s 50),
-   "🖌️ Style High"(=--s 250)
-   "🖌️ Style Very High" (=--s 750))

Example: astronaut on a horse --s 50 and astronaut on a horse --s 900
![oiu](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_s50-0c225ef95bc6846bdf0a7722579d163b.webp)
![nadana](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_s900-3b0b7fb6c93dfaf99792a64df2c947f2.webp)

## Version:

--v [version number]or --version [version number] let you access earlier Midjourney models (1-3)

Example: --v 1, --v 2, and --v 3
![oi](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_v1-6ae8fd9348af1e05565d70629aaf8acd.webp)
![uy](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_v2-430c391db587acf92a4b8635349770a0.webp)
![poiu](https://learnprompting.org/assets/images/midjourney_astronaut_params_v3-2c4dd5a413bb8eb8a1cdace4477357a6.webp)

## Video

--video creates a short movie of the image grid being generated. Reacting with the ✉️ emoji lets the Midjourney Bot send you a DM with the link to the video.

Example: astronaut on a horse --video --v 3
![Alt text](https://learnprompting.org/midjourney.mp4)
